clinical_study.brief_title: Resolution of Primary Immune Defect in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Resolution of Primary Immune Defect in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock:
- Evaluate about age of resolution in immune defect in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome
- Incidence of immunodeficiencies in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome

detailed_description.textblock: 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome is the most common for microdeletion syndrome. The incidence is about 1:4000 of live birth. Clinical features in this syndrome are vary which consist of conotruncal cardiac anomalies, developmental disabilities, palatal anomalies, speech delay, hypocalcemia, characteristic facial features and immunodeficiencies. The most common type of immunodeficiencies is T cell defect that associated with thymic hypoplasia. In the present time, the investigators don't know about the resolution of immune defect in this syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: age of resolution in immune defect in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of immunodeficiencies in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 22q11.2 deletion syndrome patients in allergy and immunology clinic, genetic clinic, cardio clinic, genetic clinic and development clinic
Exclusion Criteria:
- loss follow up in 22q11.2 deletion syndrome patients or incomplete medical record
